etymologies: Middle English: the verb from Old French returner, from Latin re- ‘back’ + tornare ‘to turn’; the noun via Anglo-Norman French

definitions: come or go back to a place or person

examples.text: he returned to Canada in the fall

shortDefinitions: come or go back to place or person

definitions: go back to (a particular state or activity)

examples.text: Ollie had returned to full health

shortDefinitions: go back to

definitions: turn one's attention back to (something)

examples.text: he returned to his newspaper

shortDefinitions: divert one's attention back to

definitions: (especially of a feeling) come back or recur after a period of absence

examples.text: her appetite had returned

shortDefinitions: reoccur after period of absence

definitions: give, put, or send (something) back to a place or person

examples.text: complete the application form and return it to this address

shortDefinitions: give, put, or send something back to place or person

definitions: feel, say, or do (the same feeling, action, etc.) in response

examples.text: she returned his kiss

shortDefinitions: feel, say, or do (same feeling, action, etc.) in response

definitions: (in tennis and other sports) hit or send (the ball) back to an opponent

examples.text: the aim is to make the other side unable to return the ball

shortDefinitions: (in tennis and other sports) hit or send ball back to opponent

definitions: run upfield with the ball after fielding (a kick), intercepting (a pass), or recovering (a fumble)

examples.text: they had six passes intercepted—five were returned for touchdowns

shortDefinitions: intercept and run upfield with ball

definitions: (of a judge or jury) state or present (a verdict) in response to a formal request

examples.text: the jury returned the unanimous guilty verdict

shortDefinitions: (of judge or jury) state or present decision or verdict in response to formal request

definitions: lead (a card of a suit led earlier by one's partner)

examples.text: he returned a Diamond won by his partner who now played the 10 of Spades

shortDefinitions: lead after taking trick

definitions: yield or make (a profit)

examples.text: the company returned a profit of 4.3 million dollars

shortDefinitions: yield or make

definitions: (of an electorate) elect (a person or party) to office

examples.text: the Democrat was returned in the third district

shortDefinitions: (of electorate) elect person or party to office

definitions: continue (a wall) in a changed direction, especially at right angles.
shortDefinitions: continue wall in changed direction

definitions: an act of coming or going back to a place or activity

examples.text: he celebrated his safe return from the war
a return flight

shortDefinitions: act of coming or going back to place or activity

definitions: an act of going back to an earlier state or condition

examples.text: the designer advocated a return to elegance

shortDefinitions: act of going back to earlier state or situation

definitions: the action of giving, sending, or putting something back

examples.text: we demand the return of our books and papers

shortDefinitions: action of returning something

definitions: a play in which the ball is caught after a kick or pass interception and is advanced by running; an advance of this kind.
shortDefinitions: play in which ball is caught after kick or pass interception and is advanced by running

definitions: (in tennis and other sports) a stroke played in response to a serve or other stroke by one's opponent.
shortDefinitions: (in tennis and other sports) stroke played in response to serve or other stroke by one's opponent

definitions: a thing that has been given or sent back, especially an unwanted ticket for a sports event or play

examples.text: it might be worth checking with the box office for returns

shortDefinitions: thing which has been given back

definitions: a ticket that allows someone to travel to a place and back again; a round trip ticket

examples.text: a return ticket to the airport

shortDefinitions: ticket which allows someone to travel to place and back again

definitions: an electrical conductor bringing a current back to its source.
shortDefinitions: electrical conductor bringing current back

definitions: a second contest between the same opponents.
shortDefinitions: second contest between same opponents

definitions: a profit from an investment

examples.text: product areas are being developed to produce maximum returns

shortDefinitions: profit from investment

definitions: a good rate of return.
shortDefinitions: good rate of return

definitions: an official report or statement submitted in response to a formal demand

examples.text: census returns

shortDefinitions: official report or statement submitted in response to formal demand

definitions: an official report of the results of an election

examples.text: falsification of the election return

shortDefinitions: returning officer's announcement of election result

definitions: an endorsement or report by a court officer or sheriff on a writ.
shortDefinitions: endorsement or report by court officer or sheriff on writ

definitions: election to office

examples.text: we campaigned for the return of Young and Elkins

shortDefinitions: election to office

definitions: a key pressed to move the carriage of an electric typewriter back to a fixed position.
shortDefinitions: mechanism or key on typewriter that returns carriage to fixed position at start of new line

definitions: a key pressed on a computer keyboard to simulate a carriage return in a word-processing program, or to indicate the end of a command or data string.
shortDefinitions: key pressed on computer keyboard to simulate carriage return in word-processing program

definitions: a part receding from the line of the front, for example the side of a house or of a window opening.
shortDefinitions: part receding from line of front
